info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 15 at 3:31PM CDT until May 15 at 4:15PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN CRAWFORD COUNTY... At 330 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Lee Creek, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations in or near the path include... Cedarville... Mountainburg... Natural Dam... Chester... Rudy... Figure Five... Lee Creek... Lake Fort Smith... Locke... This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 25 and 40. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
